intro: Phacelia neglecta, commonly known as the desert phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Phacelia neglecta is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
